More Notes: The report mentions that Vietnamese mangroves protect $7 billion worth of property and more people from flooding compared to any other nation, but does not provide more detailed quantitative analysis on economic costs or benefits.
These values represent carbon storage potential of mangroves in Vietnam, which has implications for climate change mitigation. Reported as a range from 765 to 1026 MgC/ha; 895.5 is the midpoint.
82% of marine products in the country are derived from inshore areas. These are considered vital to local economies.
